The Department of Defense paid Gilead: 34.5 million to develop remdesivir as a possible treatment for the Ebola virus.
The National Institutes of Health awarde: 6 million grant to researchers at the University of North Carolina to speed up the development of remdesivir.
The NIH invested: 30 million in a clinical trial to observe how remdesivir acted against COVID-19.
Both the Department of Defense and NIH a: money, indicating that taxpayers indirectly contributed to the development of remdesivir.
